channel.title: R on Little
channel.description: Recent content in R on Little

item.title: Test Post
item.description: This is a test R markdown post to show a leaflet interactive plot. # Code borrowed from Leaflet R website library(geojsonio) library(leaflet) # File downloaded from the census website states <- geojsonio::geojson_read("https://raw.githubusercontent.com/zoewu/little-blog/master/static/gz_2010_us_040_00_5m.geojson", method = "web",what = "sp") bins <- c(seq(1,200000,40000),Inf) pal <- colorBin("YlOrRd", domain = states$CENSUSAREA, bins = bins) labels <- sprintf( "<strong>%s</strong><br/>%g people / mi<sup>2</sup>", states$NAME, states$CENSUSAREA ) %>% lapply(htmltools::HTML) leaflet(states) %>% setView(-96, 37.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com. You can embed an R code chunk like this: # Code borrowed from Leaflet R website library(geojsonio) library(leaflet) # File downloaded from the census website summary(cars) ## speed dist ## Min. : 4.0 Min. : 2.00 ## 1st Qu.:12.0 1st Qu.
